result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley C. Van Hoosen

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Bradley C. Van Hoosen not in court.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft does not appear.
DA heard and requests a bench warrant.
Court so orders.
10:01 AM

11:50 AM Defendant Bradley C. Van Hoosen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Hansen is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Hansen heard - deft understands charges and penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court reinstates the $500 cash bail w/ same conditions as previously ordered.
Court imposes an additional $500 signature bond with same conditions as ordered in the cash bond.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
12:00 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:48 AM Defendant Bradley C. Van Hoosen not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft does not appear.
ADA heard and requests bench warrant.
Court so orders.
9:44 AM

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley C. Van Hoosen
Current: 1812 Thomas St, Marinette, WI 54143 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: W10548 Newton Lane, Athelstane, WI 54104
Order For Defendant To Abstain From Alcohol And For Testing

8:30 AM Defendant Bradley C. Van Hoosen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Deft updates current address to: 1812 Thomas St, Marinette, WI.
Court imposes $500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no entry into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, compliance with Soberlink, may not go to Menominee or Dickinson County, may not go into any state where THC is legal. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
8:38 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
